title: How Russia Put Its Future at Risk by Remaking Its Economy for War
partialText: About half of the country’s federal budget goes toward the fight in Ukraine, money that does little to support its long-term development.

title: These Ukrainians Don’t Want to Be Traded to Russia for Peace
partialText: Four years into the war, a major sticking point in talks is control of the eastern Donetsk region. Residents could face an agonizing choice if Ukraine gives up the territory.

title: Russia Moves Closer to Banning Telegram App, Saying It Foments Terrorism
partialText: News of an investigation into Pavel Durov, the app’s billionaire founder, deepened a crackdown on what remains of the free Russian internet.

title: ICE Whistle-Blower Says Training Is ‘Broken,’ and OpenAI Faces Questions About Mass Shooter
partialText: Plus, how Mexico tracked its most-wanted cartel leader.

title: The Looming Taiwan Chip Disaster That Silicon Valley Has Long Ignored
partialText: If China invades Taiwan and cuts off its chip exports to American companies, the tech industry and the U.S. economy would be crippled.

title: Racing to Catch up With Nvidia, AMD Signs Chips-for-Stock Deal With Meta
partialText: The multibillion-dollar deal is AMD’s latest move to catch up to Nvidia in the lucrative world of selling artificial intelligence chips.

title: China Amps Up Pressure on Japan With Restrictions on Exports
partialText: Beijing placed the restrictions on 20 Japanese entities with ties to the defense industry, the latest ratcheting up of its monthslong feud with Tokyo.

title: Intel Strikes Deal With a Chip Start-Up Its C.E.O. Invested In
partialText: A technical partnership embraces SambaNova Systems, which Intel’s chief, Lip-Bu Tan, helps lead as an investor and chairman.

title: Mexico Is Caught Between Trump and the Cartels
partialText: President Trump has demanded President Claudia Sheinbaum confront the cartels. The killing of “El Mencho” suggests it might be working — but could come at a cost.

title: Mexican Forces Say They Tracked El Mencho to Cabin by Following His Lover
partialText: Top security officials revealed details of the operation that led to the death of Mexico’s most wanted drug cartel leader.

title: Is It Safe to Travel to Mexico Right Now, Given the Cartel Violence?
partialText: A wave of unrest after the killing of a cartel leader has rattled tourists at popular destinations in Mexico, prompting travelers to reconsider their plans. Here’s what to know.

title: New York City’s Homeless Population Endures Another Dangerous Storm
partialText: Mayor Zohran Mamdani said on Monday that his administration had taken lessons from the city’s last storm, when at least 20 people died after exposure to the cold.

title: What to Know in NYC After Blizzard: School Closures, Transportation and More
partialText: Public schools and Broadway theaters will be open, but transit and flight disruptions could linger.

title: A Blizzard With Record Snowfall for Parts of the Northeast
partialText: At the storm’s peak, well over half a million homes and businesses in the Northeast were without power.

title: Ahead of State of the Union, Cracks Appear in Trump Coalition
partialText: As the president prepares to speak to the nation, Northeastern Pennsylvania is showing discontent on the edges of the Trump coalition and an energized Democratic opposition.

title: State of the Union May Be a Trial for ‘Barely Invited’ Justices
partialText: If tradition holds, members of the Supreme Court will attend Trump’s annual speech, just days after ruling against the legality of his tariffs.

title: Trump State of the Union Speech 2026: How to Watch, Time and Attendees
partialText: President Trump will speak at 9 p.m. Eastern time to a joint session of Congress. The New York Times will carry the address live.

title: How Jeffrey Epstein Ingratiated Himself With Top Microsoft Executives
partialText: For more than two decades, the convicted sex offender developed a network at the tech giant, making him privy to succession discussions and other business.

title: Mandelson’s Arrest Adds to Scandal That Has Rattled Starmer and Labour Party
partialText: The arrest of the British former envoy to Washington, long a key figure in the Labour Party, deepened a scandal that has led to calls for Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s resignation.

title: Homeownership Is Out of Reach for Many Americans, Despite a Buyer’s Market
partialText: A growing split between low-to-middle-income families and wealthy households is changing who has access to homeownership now.

title: Paramount Revises Its Bid for Warner Bros. Discovery
partialText: If Warner Bros. deems Paramount’s latest bid superior, Netflix would have four days to make a counteroffer.

title: Trump Says General Caine Sees Easy Victory if U.S. Attacks Iran
partialText: The remarks differ from what Gen. Dan Caine, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, is said to have told the president in high-level White House meetings.

title: Iranians Brace for War as Trump Considers Targeted Strikes
partialText: Stores are well stocked, and there have been no reports of shortages of food and other essentials, but many Iranians are in limbo as they wait to see whether U.S. forces will attack.

title: Mamdani’s Vanquished Foes Are Plotting a Comeback, if Not Revenge
partialText: Many of New York City’s wealthy and well-connected power players find themselves in an unfamiliar place: the wilderness.

title: In Blow to Mamdani, Left-Leaning Group Breaks With Mayor Over U.S. House Race
partialText: Mayor Zohran Mamdani of New York had lobbied for his preferred candidate, Claire Valdez. But the party backed Antonio Reynoso, the Brooklyn borough president.

title: I.R.S. Tactics Against Meta Open a New Front in the Corporate Tax Fight
partialText: The agency is using real-world profit data to challenge how big companies value offshore intellectual property.

title: What Brontë Country Tells Us About Britain Today
partialText: West Yorkshire, where the original “Wuthering Heights” was written, offers a window into the forces that are disrupting British politics.

title: Trump’s New Tariffs Are Illegal Too
partialText: Just another attempt to ignore the law and dare the courts to step in.

title: Trump Is Turning the F.C.C. and F.T.C. Against Free Expression
partialText: Trump appointees have transformed the F.T.C. and F.C.C. into instruments of ideological enforcement.

title: Your Tariff Questions
partialText: We’re addressing some of your concerns about President Trump’s tariff regime.

title: Late Night Sums Up Trump’s Tariff Tiff with the Supreme Court
partialText: “Wow, a court composed mostly of his own party’s appointees has struck down the constitutionality of Trump’s go-it-alone tariff regime,” Jon Stewart said. “That’s bound to cause him some introspection.”

title: Supreme Court Sides With Couple in Case Involving Baby Food Sold at Whole Foods
partialText: The court agreed to revive a lawsuit by a Texas couple who claimed that tainted baby food purchased at Whole Foods had sickened their young son.

title: Trump’s Justice Department Sues New Jersey Governor Over ICE Enforcement
partialText: The lawsuit is the latest federal challenge to policies enacted in Democrat-led states. Similar suits have targeted laws in New York, Minnesota and California.

title: Robert Carradine, Actor Who Played the Father in ‘Lizzie McGuire,’ Dies at 71
partialText: A member of a renowned acting dynasty, he also earned fame for his role in “Revenge of the Nerds.” His family said he struggled with bipolar disorder.

title: Gustavo Dudamel’s Long Goodbye to L.A., and Long Hello to New York
partialText: As the conductor prepares to leave the Los Angeles Philharmonic for the New York Philharmonic, he says, “I am in two waters.”
